alert.note: Alert for Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued April 22 at 3:30AM CDT until April 24 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures in the upper 20s to low 30s. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Illinois, east central, northeast and southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, through 9 AM CDT this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night to early Sunday morning and late Sunday night through early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
